com.aevi.print.model

Class PrinterSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aevi.print.model.PrinterSettings
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Jsonable

    public class PrinterSettings
extends java.lang.Object
implements Jsonable
    Contains information such as name, DPI and paper width for a specific PrinterSettings on the Device.

      • getPrinterId

        public java.lang.String getPrinterId()
        Gets the unique Id of this printer.
        Returns:

        Returns:

      • getPrintableWidth

        public int getPrintableWidth()
        Gets the actual available printing width in mm. This is usually the width of the paper minus any left/right margins
        Returns:
        The available printing width in mm

      • getPaperDotsPerMm

        public float getPaperDotsPerMm()
        Gets the resolution of the printer in dots per mm (dpmm).
        Returns:
        the dots per mm this printer has for the given paper size above.

      • getCommands

        public java.lang.String[] getCommands()
        A list of commands this printer can execute
        Returns:
        A list of string commands that can be sent to this printer to perform printer specific functionality

      • getCodepages

        public int[] getCodepages()
        A list of codepages supported by this printer
        Returns:
        A list of codepage ids that can be used with this printer. See printer specific documentation for details

      • doesSupportCodePages

        public boolean doesSupportCodePages()
        Returns:
        True if this printer makes use of codepages which will be given in the list getCodepages()

      • getOptions

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getOptions()
        A map of key/value pair options that have been setup for this printer
        Returns:
        Map of printer specific key value pair settings

      • canHandleCommands

        public boolean canHandleCommands()
        Returns:
        True if this printer can handle commands/actions sent via PrinterManager.sendAction(String, String)

      • doesReportPrinterStatus

        public boolean doesReportPrinterStatus()
        Returns:
        True if this printer will report its status to PrinterManager.status(String)

      • getSupportedLanguages

        Returns a list of two letter (ISO 639) language codes that are supported by this printer
